description.narrative: Accelerator Lab PRY busca ser un espacio de descubrimiento, experimentación, aprendizaje, e innovación para el desarrollo social. El laboratorio busca construir la mayor red de aprendizaje del mundo en torno al desarrollo.

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative:
Output 1: UNDP Country Offices and partners will have increased capability for scanning, sensemaking and experimentation for sustainable development solutions in 60 developing countries.
1.1 Number of new data sources used at Country Office level. 1.2 Diversity of different data sources used 1.3 Number of sustainable development solutions identified and documented 1.4 Variety of innovation methods used to test and iterate over the different hypotheses.
Output 2: New sustainable development solutions will be scaled at country level as part of UNDP’s country programme and operations, national policy and/or local markets.
2.1 Learning the Accelerator Lab Network shares with a public audience (outside of UNDP) 2.2 Number of lab insights, processes or products which are taken up by governments or other partners 2.3 Proportion of partners and governments that increase their take up of the innovation methods included in the Accelerator Lab Network suite 2.4 Proportion of UNDP Country Office programming influenced by the Accelerator Lab Network’s work and methodologies.
Output 3: A core global level result will be that a global learning and scaling network is established and functioning.
3.1 Size and density of the network effects among the Accelerator Labs 3.2 Number of new models, approaches, and insights documented and disseminated throughout the network. 3.3 Engagement of the broader Development ecosystem with published learnings from the Accelerator Lab Network. 3.4 Amount of influence the learnings and methods of the Accelerator Lab Networks have on the discourse of the broader Development ecosystem.
Output 2: New sustainable development solutions will be scaled at country level as part of UNDP’s country programme and operations, national policy and/or local markets.
2.1 Learning the Accelerator Lab Network shares with a public audience (outside of UNDP) 2.2 Number of lab insights, processes or products which are taken up by go

comment.narrative:
Output 1: 1.1 2 new sources of data per year. 1.2 3 different type of data sources per year. 1.3 20 new potential solutions per lab per year. 1.4 2 innovation methods per Action Plan.
Output 2: 2.1 3 blogs, or other (substantial) media posts published per year. 2.2 At least 50% of our learning challenges have the public sector or other partner as counterpart. 2.3 At least one government entity or partner has learned about Accelerator lab methods. 2.4 At least 50% of our learning challenges are providing actionable knowledge to ongoing CO projects.
Output 3: 3.1 The lab interacts at least once a week with another lab in the network. 48 interaction per year: 3.2 5% of information shared across the network should be methodology, or sustainable development issue and opportunity related. 3.3 The Accelerator Lab Network´s work is featured at least 2 times per month in Country Office Social Media channels and tag UNDP Accelerator Labs accounts. The Lab team engages at least once a month across any social media conversation related to the work of the Accelerator Lab Network, from either personal or CO account. 3.4 Connect the Accelerator Lab’s publications to local development ecosystem through social media. Identify and engage with 2 new relevant local social media profiles of the broader Development Ecosystem.

Output 1:
1.1 2 new sources of data per year: 1.2 3 different type of data sources per year: 1) Official Data 2) Ethnographic data 3) Open Data 1.3 20 new potential solutions per lab per year: 0 solutions mapped. 1.4 2 innovation methods per Action Plan: 1) Solutions Mapping 2) Human Centered Design
Output 2:
2.1 3 blogs, or other (substantial) media posts published per year: 2.2 At least 50% of our learning challenges have the public sector or other partner as counterpart: Presidential Delivery Unit, Social Policy Delivery Unit 2.3 At least one government entity or partner has learned about Accelerator lab methods: National Innovation Strategy close collaboration for their workshops design for the identification and validations of national innovation challenges across the country. 2.4 At least 50% of our learning challenges are providing actionable knowledge to ongoing CO projects: Carayao, Asunción Green City of the Americas, Programa Pequeñas Donaciones.
Output 3:
3.1 The lab interacts at least once a week with another lab in the network. 48 interaction per year: One a week for Drop-In calls and biweekly calls by role (solution mappers, explorers, and experimenters) 3.2 5% of information shared across the network should be methodology, or sustainable development issue and opportunity related: UNDP Paraguay shared content introducing the acclab members and its learning cycle methodology, specifically Solutions Mapping. 3.3 The Accelerator Lab Network´s work is featured at least 2 times per month in Country Office Social Media channels and tag UNDP Accelerator Labs accounts. The Lab team engages at least once a month across any social media conversation related to the work of the Accelerator Lab Network, from either personal or CO account: The AccLab works along with the CO Communication Team providing relevant information about its current line of work and collaborations with the CO Projects (Carayao, Asunción Green City of the Americas) 3.4 Connect the Accelerator Lab’s publications to local development ecosystem through social media. Identify and engage with 2 new relevant local social media profiles of the broader Development Ecosystem: On its first months the AccLab initiate close collaboration with the National Innovation Strategy and the government new social protecting scheme.

Output 1: 1.1 5 new data sources per year. 1.2 6 different type of data sources per year. 1.3 35 new potential solutions per lab per year. 1.4 5 innovation methods per Action Plan.
Output 2: 2.1 At least 6 blogs or other (substantial) media posts published per year. 2.2 At least 50% of our learning challenges have the public sector or other partner as counterpart. 2.3 At least one government entity or partner has adopted an accelerator lab method. 2.4 At least 50% of our learning challenges are providing actionable knowledge to ongoing CO projects.
Output 3: 3.1 The lab interacts at least once a week with another lab in the network. 48 interaction per year. 3.2 25% of information shared across the network should be methodology, or sustainable development issue and opportunity related. The Accelerator Lab Networks work is featured at least 3 times per month in Country Office Social Media channels and tag UNDP Accelerator Labs accounts. 3.3 The Lab team engages at least once a month across any social media conversation related to the work of the Accelerator Lab Network, from either personal or CO account. 3.4 Connect the Accelerator Lab’s publications to local development ecosystem through social media. Identify and engage with 5 new relevant local social media profiles of the broader Development Ecosystem.

Output 1:
1.1 5 new data sources per year: Wendá Platform, Permanent Household Survey, Social Capital Survey, Inclusive Recicling Prototype Micro-Survey and Shadowing, Informal Construction Workers 1.2 6 different type of data sources per year: : 1) Official Data from Government Institutions 2) Ethnographic data , interviews, observations note-taking, micro survey, cultural probes etc. 3) Solution mapping, social innovation contest using the platform “Wendá” 1.3 35 new potential solutions per lab per year: 35 solutions mapped. 1.4 5 innovation methods per Action Plan: 1) Solutions Mapping 2) Human Centered Design 3) Sensemaking 4) Collective intelligence 5) Randomized Controlled Trials
Output 2:
2.1 At least 6 blogs or other (substantial) media posts published per year: 2.2 At least 50% of our learning challenges have the public sector or other partner as counterpart: Most of the learning cycles developed by the Laboratory include the participation of the public sector, civil society and academia, some of them were: Presidential Delivery Unit; Employment Observatory of the Ministry of Labor, Employment and Social Security; National Council of Science and Technology (CONACYT); SDG Paraguay Commission; Center for Research and Development Resources, 2.3 At least one government entity or partner has adopted an accelerator lab method: The Participatory Laboratory for the Formalization of Employment project was carried out in collaboration with the technical team of the Employment Observatory of the Ministry of Labor, Employment and Social Security. The work carried out by the team of consultants completed a learning cycle on access to social security for mostly informal workers within the construction sector. 2.4 At least 50% of our learning challenges are providing actionable knowledge to ongoing CO projects: Asunción Green City of the Americas; Monitoreo y Evaluacion (REPAE), Programa Pequeñas Donaciones, Infodemia Challenge
Output 3:
3.1 The lab interacts at least once a week with another lab in the network. 48 interaction per year: One a week for Drop-In calls and biweekly calls by role (solution mappers, explorers, and experimenters) 3.2 25% of information shared across the network should be methodology, or sustainable development issue and opportunity related. The Accelerator Lab Networks work is featured at least 3 times per month in Country Office Social Media channels and tag UNDP Accelerator Labs accounts: The AccLab works along with the CO Communication Team providing relevant information about its current line of work and collaborations with the CO Projects. 3.3 The Lab team engages at least once a month across any social media conversation related to the work of the Accelerator Lab Network, from either personal or CO account: 3.4 Connect the Accelerator Lab’s publications to local development ecosystem through social media. Identify and engage with 5 new relevant local social media profiles of the broader Development Ecosystem:

Output 1:
1.1 10 new data sources per year. 1.2 9 different type of data sources per year. 1.3 50 new potential solutions per lab per year. 1.4 10 innovation methods per Action Plan.
Output 2:
2.1 At least 8 blogs, or other (substantial) media posts published per year. 2.2 At least 50% of our learning challenges have the public sector or other partner as counterpart. 2.3 At least one government entity or partner has adopted an accelerator lab method. 2.4 At least 50% of our learning challenges are providing actionable knowledge to ongoing CO projects.
Output 3:
3.1 The lab interacts at least once a week with another lab in the network. 48 interaction per year. 3.2 50% of information shared across the network should be methodology, or sustainable development issue and opportunity related. 3.3 The Accelerator Lab Network’s work is featured at least 3 times per month in Country Office Social Media channels and tag UNDP Accelerator Labs accounts. The Lab team engages at least once a month across any social media conversation related to the work of the Accelerator Lab Network, from either personal or CO account. 3.4 Connect the Accelerator Lab’s publications to local development ecosystem through social media. Identify and engage with 10 new relevant local social media profiles of the broader Development Ecosystem.
